spared.spot_features.compute_patches_embeddings

spared.spot_features.compute_patches_embeddings(adata: AnnData, backbone: str = 'densenet', model_path: str = 'None', patch_size: int = 224) → None[source]

Compute model’s embeddings for patches.

This function computes patch embeddings (last linear layer representations) for a given backbone model and adata object. It can optionally compute using a stored model in model_path or a pretrained model from Pytorch. The embeddings are stored in adata.obsm[f'embeddings_{backbone}']. The patches are expected to be have int values from 0 to 255 and all the needed transformations are performed inside. They also must be flattened and stored in adata.obsm[f'patches_scale_{patch_scale}'] with shape (n_patches, patch_size*patch_size*3). The patch_scale value is not important for this function. The only important condition is that there is a single key starting with patches_scale in the adata.obsm keys.

The function modifies the AnnData object in place.

Parameters:

  • adata (ad.AnnData) – The AnnData object to process.

  • backbone (str, optional) – A string specifying the backbone model to use. Must be one of the following ['resnet', 'resnet50', 'ConvNeXt', 'EfficientNetV2', 'InceptionV3', 'MaxVit', 'MobileNetV3', 'ResNetXt', 'ShuffleNetV2', 'ViT', 'WideResnet', 'densenet', 'swin']. Defaults to 'densenet'.

  • model_path (str, optional) – The path to a stored model. If set to 'None', then an ImageNet pretrained model is used. Defaults to 'None'.

  • patch_size (int, optional) – The size of the patches. Defaults to 224.

Raises:

ValueError – If the backbone is not supported. Or if there are more than one key starting with patches_scale in the adata.obsm keys.
